JobFullDesc: Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? A system's professional who wants to work in a collaborative environment. As an experienced PBCS/EPBCS Consultant you will have the ability to share new ideas and collaborate on projects as a consultant without the extensive demands of travel. Consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center - we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.  Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below...  Work you'll do/Responsibilities   As a Consultant you will work with our client to:  Design, develop, implement and support financial planning and reporting solutions using Oracle EPBCS as well as providing technical and functional guidance, assistance and support to client staff using this product and service (70%)  Perform unit, system and interface testing associated with the Oracle EPBCS product and corresponding system interface areas, as well as provide guidance and assistance to client staff to support these testing activities (10%)  Develop associated technical and functional Oracle EPCBS documentation including but not limited to requirements, design, code testing and end user documents, etc. (10%)  Attend and participate in requisite project and operational meetings and work sessions and provide timely updates on work performed to client peers, and management (10%)  Improve business processes around budget formulation, budget execution, financial reporting and data analysis  Collaborate and provide support to junior developers to complete all phases of the application development lifecycle. This includes process redesign, system design, Agile development, data integration, training and ongoing support to customer personnel.  The Team   Deloitte's Government & Public Services practice-our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Our team of over 15,000+ professionals bring fresh perspective to help you anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill your mission promise .  Our Finance & Enterprise Performance team works as a trusted advisor to CFOs, COOs, CIOs, and key executives. We advise, implement and operate transformational solutions that create world-class finance, shared services and real estate capabilities. We bring together different, but highly complementary practices, allowing us to go to market more effectively and bring unparalleled breadth and depth of expertise to our clients which is unmatched by our competitors today.  Qualifications  Required   3+ years of experienced with Oracle PBCS/EPBCS; Budgeting; Oracle Planning & Budgeting Cloud Services (PBCS); Oracle/Hyperion Enterprise Performance Management (EPM);  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent professional experience  Must be willing to work/relocate to Lake Mary, FL, Gilbert, AZ or Mechanicsburg, PA  Travel up to 20% annually (While 20% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)  Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future  Preferred   4+ years of experience as an application developer with strong skills and knowledge with FR reporting (including hands-on experience with creating and maintaining HFR)  Business rules and calculation, Smart View Adhoc, Webforms, Multiple managed PODS and releases, EPM Automate - with error handling, power shell scripting, and high-volume integrations and data loads  Essbase / Hyperion Planning, architecting, designing and implementing integrated Oracle EPBCS solutions with outside enterprise services, data sources and associated security protocols  Business requirements gathering and analysis, with emphasis on fit gap  Authoring functional and technical specifications, developing test plans, conducting unit and integration testing, troubleshooting technical and user issues and interacting with business end users. Creating, managing and helping to resolve Oracle Service Requests (SRs) o Successful release schedule deployments  Understanding, analyzing and articulating common business processes and decisions to develop easy to use customer solutions. Excellent analytical ability  Ability to manage and complete multiple tasks in a timely manner o Ability to effectively operate independently or in a team environment  Outstanding MS Office and data modeling skills  Excellent verbal and written communication skills
